repnme.cdata!: Mexico - Second Solid Waste Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Solid Waste Project was rated
            as satisfactory although unsustainable, with substantial
            institutional development impact and satisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and the Borrower. The economic
            crisis in Mexico affected project implementation and caused
            cancellation of the majority of the project. The
            restructured project focused on institutional strengthening,
            training, and dissemination, as well as limited subproject
            finance. In addition to the achievements of the restructured
            project objectives, the project facilitated and paved the
            way for the demonstration project for Methane gas capture
            and use at a landfill. Also, due to the project, there has
            been considerable private sector interest and willingness to
            engage in management of solid waste in municipalities.

repnme.cdata!: Mexico - Second Solid Waste Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objectives of the Second Solid
            Waste Management Project are to: a) improve solid waste
            services and extend their coverage in participating medium
            size cities; b) strengthen the capacity of Banco Nacional de
            Obras y Servicios Publicos and the Ministry of Social
            Development to appraise and supervise solid waste projects
            and provide technical assistance to municipalities; c)
            increase technical, administrative and regulatory capacity
            at the state and local levels to improve sector management
            and operations; d) improve the legal and regulatory
            framework and cost recovery mechanisms of the sector to
            encourage greater private sector involvement and safeguard
            the environment; e) correct environmental problems and
            reduce health hazards caused by inadequate collection and
            disposal systems; and f) mitigate the social impact on
            scavangers of the establishment of modern waste collection
            and disposal systems. The project will have three main
            components: 1) strengthening of federal institutions, local
            governments and operating agencies which play a key role in
            development of the sector; 2) supporting the investment
            needs of participating cities through implementation of
            comprehensive and integrated solid waste management plans;
            and 3) providing support for scavengers and informal workers
            impacted by the project through a social component.

732922.trustfund:
TF023017-PHRD-HAZARDOUS WASTE PROJECT,TF023016-PHRD-BOARDER ENVIRONMENTAL

repnme.cdata!:
Mexico - Second Solid Waste Management
            Project : reporte de evaluacion ambiental en Mexico del
            sector de residuos solidos

abstracts.cdata!:
Today in Mexico there exists great
            difficulties in the disposal of tons of municipal,
            industrial, hospital and other dangerous wastes which are
            generated daily. Addressing this very serious problem
            implies the need for complete coordination of diverse
            sectors and public and private institutions. This report
            identifies problems derived from the generation and
            management of solid waste. Accordingly, the report evaluates
            these problems through environmental assessment measures as
            well as at a normative national, state and municipal level.
            The report proposes an environmental action plan to assist
            national, state and municipal entities in order for them to
            initiate environmental impact assessment activities together
            with legal and institutional measures.

display_title.display_title:

            gestión de los desechos sólidos: Informe de evaluación
